newsitem.title: USA: Motorola wins $100 million Philippine contract.
newsitem.headline: Motorola wins $100 million Philippine contract.

text.p: Motorola Inc. said Tuesday that its Asia Pacific Cellular Infrastructure unit has signed a contract worth more than $100 million to install a fixed wireless telephone network in the southern and western Mindanao regions of the Philippines.

The contract is part of a so-called build-and-transfer arrangement between the Pilipino Telephone Corp. or Piltel, and Japan's Marubeni Corp., which calls for Marubeni to build the network for Piltel to operate it.
The Motorola network will fulfil part of Piltel's commitment to provide 400,000 additional telephone lines in southern regions of the Philippines, Motorola said.
The network will provide service for residential and business subscribers in cities such as Davao, General Santos, Pagadian, Zamboanga and Dipolog.
Installation will begin during the fourth quarter of this year with commercial service scheduled to begin in the second quarter of 1997, Motorola said.
